## Natural history notes

The Blue Jay (Cyanocitta cristata) is a common songbird found in and around forested habitats across much of the eastern United States. A member of the crow family, Blue Jays are noted for their intelligence and complex social behavior. Their diet is highly varied and includes insects, fruits, and occasionally fish.
